source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves mostly 10–40 mm long, if shorter then linear, apex more or less pungent-pointed; calyx 2.5–4 mm long; ovules 2; far East Gippsland only
Leaves mostly 2–10 mm long, narrow-ovate, elliptic or oblong, apex with a minute recurved point; calyx 5–6 mm long; ovules 10 or more
Leaves linear, upper surface smooth or minutely tuberculate, not conspicuously reticulate; calyx teeth more or less equal; pod c. 3 mm long; montane areas
Leaves lanceolate to linear-oblong, upper surface conspicuously reticulate; upper 2 calyx teeth connate for most of their length; pod c. 5 mm long; coastal areas
